intro: Manihot palmata var. aipi, commonly known as the Aipi manihot, is a flowering plant native to the rainforests of Central and South America. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its palm-like leaves and distinctive, yellowish-green flowers. The plant produces a fleshy, edible fruit that contains a single seed, which is often used in traditional medicine. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is adapted to nutrient-poor soils. Its botanical features make it an important species for both ecological and ethnobotanical studies.
